intro: Arkezostis calycina, commonly known as the calycine bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that typically range in color from blue to purple. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Arkezostis calycina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
